website_summaries.verdict: If you prefer a clip-on pedometer, this one has some nice features and functions – but requires some time and patience to program it.
pros: An affordable clip-style pedometer that earns praise for its accuracy and 30-day storage
cons: The instructions lack detail, and set up can be challenging
Design is larger than other clip pedometers

customer_reviews.title: lasted only two months
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for two months. I used it every day, and was pleased with accuracy, ease of use, and light weight. But today, the numbers became unreadable, because half of the "bars" forming each number have ceased to function. I tried resetting, but that was no help. It's not a power problem, because half the numbers are there, just not enough to be readable. I'm bummed.
customer_reviews.author: John F Hazelton Jr

customer_reviews.title: I returned product, One Tweak Pedometer would randomly reset at least once a day. A big pain to use.
customer_reviews.text: I returned product, One Tweak EZ-1 Pedometer would randomly reset at least once a day, causing loss of steps, time, date and personal data (stride length, weight, step goal). The first time it reset, I wondered if I had inadvertently reset, but after in reset twice more even though I was much more careful with it, that was it. Basically a big pain to use.
customer_reviews.author: JU

customer_reviews.title: Small, easy to set up and not complicated to use.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t want a device that did everything but the laundry. After reading reviews about many of the ones on Amazon I chose this one. I like that this pedometer is small, easy to set up and not complicated. It seems to fairly accurately record my steps. I don’t care if it is 100% accurate as my goal is to be motivated to exercise more. It would be nice if the device were reversible in the clip holder because every time I clip or I clip it I hit the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: lake girl

customer_reviews.title: Accurate  Easy Set up
customer_reviews.text: A few minutes setting up with easy to follow instructions and I was off and walking using the lanyard provided. I usually count my first 100 steps and match my count against the device. One Tweak was right with me. I wore an another simultaneously and it was off 6 steps. Having owned at least a dozen different pedometers over the years I match two that are close and average the difference. I can recommend One Tweak based on my maiden walk.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: A PIECE OF JUNK
customer_reviews.text: What a high priced piece of junk this was. It was as inaccurate as the ones you can find around for 3 bucks. I tested it over and over with plain movement and stepping. It was either wildly above the amount I did, or lower. In either case accuracy is very important if you are going to bother to wear a pedometer and this just wasted my time and money. Tossed in garbage. Boo !!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BELIEVESINMIRACLES

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: This a product that measures activity. I believe the device itself works ok, not positive. The real problem is the case,(holder). It cannot hold even when just walking. Wouldn't hold to my pants. Then tried my belt. Then put it into my pocket backwards. Everytime it fell out. After one week I didn't notice the clamped failed again. I didn't hear it fall. I lost it. Sad I paid for something designed for active people would be so careless about such a basic need. I am out of what I paid. I Can only suggest be very careful of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Douglass Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing and throwing out dozens of useless pedometers, I finally found the perfect one that is easy to program but more importantly gives an accurate step count! Too good to be true, I thought.... I walked, jogged, ran and tested the accuracy every way I could. This pedometer is the only one you ever need to buy. It attaches securely to a waistband (many others fall off when you bend over, exercise or move around too much) and doesn’t add 100 “steps” if it’s barely moved. It is extremely accurate. I am purchasing an extra one in case I misplace this one because I wouldn’t settle for a lesser quality pedometer even for one day.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Duncan

customer_reviews.title: A tip that you won't find in the manual
customer_reviews.text: The device will accurately count your steps. But if you also want to measure distance you will have to input an accurate value for your stride length. This is best done with a GPS enabled smartphone. With an Android phone look in the PlayStore for apps with the name like "GPS Distance" or similar. Now with the app you can mark two points on your local street. Walk from one point to the other letting the OneTweak count your steps. Convert the distance to inches, divide by the reported steps and multiply by 2 (A stride is a left step plus a right step). Input your stride to the OneTweak.
customer_reviews.author: Donald A. Birdsall

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up? I don't think so
customer_reviews.text: This is not a bad product but if you are older & have poor eye site, you are in for a struggle. The words are so tiny, we had our glasses and a magnifier to help us see. If you pause for a second, as the instructions say it will stop the set operation. Very frustrating! They do offer help, but we were not sure we could see well enough to follow instructions. Finally we got it set up, and it does seem very accurate and is light weight, you don't even know it's there. Only have it 2 stars because of the difficult setup
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Tea

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have a fitness device that I wear 24/7 but it's always giving me grief. However I DO like some of the advanced features. But no matter which ones I"ve used, after a while I have charging issues or whatever. SO I got this OneTweak pedometer. First of all it's HARED to find a straight up pedometer! And sometimes that's all I want. So I ordered this as my back up step counter. It's easy to use, pretty intuitive. Also it's easy to secure. I keep it around as my back up device and am happy with it. Also an easy to read dial which helps my old eyes.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I had thought about getting a fitness tracker that you wear on your wrist, but I didn't really want to deal with the blutooth and app that had to go with it. I realized all I needed was a pedometer. This one works great. It's accurate and tells me everything I want to know, i.e. how many steps, distance, calories burned, time, etc. When I use my stationery bike, I clip it to my shoe and it works, whereas the other type would not work in this situation. I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: ALC

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit
customer_reviews.text: After reading startup instructions, I was up and walking. Step count was perfect. I re-read the instruction as I thought the Total Step Count reset at midnight. It doesn't which is really easier as I'm more interested in a weekly total. Light weight. Don't even notice it is there. My only rub is the channel for slipping the lanyard loop through to act as extra precaution when using on a belt - the channel seems to be internally at right angles so it is very difficult to thread the loop, Finally fished it through. Device seems solid and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy compared right on target with iPhone health steps app
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pedometer because I had previously purchased an "easy to use" step meter that was very easy, it was just terribly inaccurate. I am participating in the Omada Program of proper eating and exercise in order to lose weight and stave off the onset of Diabetes. I like the One Tweak as it is fairly straightforward to get set up and it automatically resets to zero every night at midnight. In addition, it keeps a running tab of how many total steps completed over time. That is a huge psychological boost.
customer_reviews.author: research4u

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little pedometer
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent pedometer for the price. Does what its supposed to do, and does it well. The numbers are large enough for my aging eyes to see, it clips on well and stays put, even through the times I have done yoga with it on me, and most importantly, it does not keep resetting itself in the middle of the day. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after returning another brand that was slightly cheaper but ended up not working at all. So frustrating. But I'm really impressed with this pedometer. It works great! It seems accurate (comparing it to the mileage on my treadmill) and I don't have to check it all day to make sure it's working. I also like the lanyard and clip that it comes with. This product is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Simple Product That Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a simple pedometer that does a basic job of tracking steps and time. I didn't want something that syncs with other devices or requires any more thought than just putting this on my waistband or in my pocket and starting my hike. This fills the bill perfectly. When I got it I called Customer Service to ask a question about set up and I had a friendly conversation with someone who was amazingly helpful and conversant and whose main focus was to help and not just get me off the phone. I like this Product so much I went back and bought another because, undoubtedly, I will lose one.
customer_reviews.author: Mosey

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I went on my first walk with the New One tweak. I am not tech savvy but the directions are easy to follow but not as easy to execute for me. So I kept reading the instructions and finally figured out how simple it is. So far so good! I just have to go back in and adjust my stride so I get a more accurate count of my steps. I like it! There's also a video I can follow.
customer_reviews.author: Princess yaya

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk ~ DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This pedometer is not accurate at all. I clipped it to my pocket and walked 67 steps to my car, got in and drove to the grocery store. I checked the pedometer before I got out and it said I had taken 339 steps! I took 67 steps to my car. Waste of money! Total junk. This is a warning DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: D Cain

customer_reviews.title: Working fine
customer_reviews.text: I only bought the pedometer to measure steps. As some reviewers said, set up can be tricky, but once you get it, all seems well. I can't comment on mileage or calories because they aren't what I look at. I like that this is a family owned business and questions in English promptly on the website. I previously bought the Batauu at $14.95, and it had nothing close to accuracy, so I returned it. I rated it one star. Next check it had disappeared from the Amazon site. Now it is back with no one star rating. This is unacceptable Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby L

customer_reviews.title: It works well.
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a pedometer for work, it's a large warehouse and she wanted to figure out her mileage each day. She reports the device was easy to set up and works well. She's doing 9,000 - 13,500 steps a day. Not bad for an "office" job! She did not use the mobile app, so I can't report on it. Update 5-13-2019 The faceplate has fallen off, I'm going to try and glue it back to the body of the unit
customer_reviews.author: K. Olinsky

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Like all of these things don't expect it to be accurate. I managed to get it somewhat accurate by adjusting my stride length to the distance I went. Example I had to use a stride length of 20 inches to get it accurate to 20 feet. My stride length is longer than this. But then this is the way it is with these things. Useful but not highly accurate. I left it in my car for a week and I was surprised how many steps my car took!
customer_reviews.author: Zahara

customer_reviews.title: Update of 1st review!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently gave a review of the problem I was having setting up this product. I would like to say this company has extremely good Customer Service! I received a call from One Tweak owner and she walked me through step by step the whole process and I was able to set up everything accurately. I have been using the product without knowing how to set up the whole thing and was able to record my steps, but this made everything else accurate, (such as the time, my weight and stride). I would highly recommend this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine G.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding pedometer and customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little device. I initially had some difficulty programming but followed the YouTube instructions and then called the seller who very nicely explained all the features and modes. I've had several pedometers and this is by far the best. It even comes with a lanyard which is really appreciated since over time I've lost earlier pedometers that I'd clipped to my belt. I highly recommend the OneTweak EZ-1 pedometer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this pedometer. It was accurate and worked well. Bought it at the end of January, and after 3 1/2 months, woke up and half the numbers are not lighting up, Thought it might have been the battery, but it wasn't. Disappointed that this happened. I really liked it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine P.

customer_reviews.title: This item is wonderful - I love the "Low-Techness" of it
customer_reviews.text: This item is wonderful - I love the "Low-Techness" of it! But what is more wonderful than the product is the awesome customer service! After a year of use I had a slight problem with the pedometer and I called the company, the owner and creator of the One Tweak - Jan - answered personally and after I explained my issue she told me how to possibly correct it but ALSO said she would send me a new pedometer. We then got into a delightful conversation. I would probably buy anything from this company/woman again without ANY concerns whatsoever - a company who stands behind their product is definitely a company I can have faith in.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy H

customer_reviews.title: HOW TO SET UP THIS DEVICE
customer_reviews.text: Purchased: May 26,2020 through Amazon Message: I have tried numerous times to set up this pedometer. I have endlessly read the instructions, watched the videos repeatedly and placed numerous calls to no avail.. I have been informed by Amazon that the return date on this item has passed. I am totally confused and frustrated. ALL I wanted was an easy clip on pedometer to track my daily steps, which seems impossible with this device. I would not recommend this device to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: This the best pedometer that I have ever owed
customer_reviews.text: This the best pedometer that I have ever owed. I mean I got mine about 2-3 weeks ago and it has been awesome. I took it too the school 1 mile track and it is spot on thank you. I would suggest this pedometer to anymore that this is the best real easy to set, well worth the money, you will not be sorry trust me. Also I spoke too the CEO of the company, she is just the nicest and very helpful to me thank And thanks again, i'm going to buy and extra one just in case one my friends ask me about it:)
customer_reviews.author: wazzup

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have to say with the first pedometer I got - I Loved it!!!!!~! While I still really love the pedometer itself, it needs a stronger, longer lasting clip (reason for 4 stars). I work in a manufacturing area and wear the pedometer on my waistband. Unfortunately, after 8 months of daily wear the clip kept slipping off and eventually I didn't realize it and lost it. I did order a different brand pedometer with a stronger clip and believe the clip was better BUT the pedometer was not accurate so I'm back buying another OneTweak. Hopefully I can keep track of this one longer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Booth

customer_reviews.title: Nice little device to track your milage and calories.
customer_reviews.text: Once you get it set up it just attaches to your belt or keep it in your pocket and it will track all of your steps and calories. It is very lightweight and easy to carry around. I am going to enjoy using my new toy while I go on my morning walks.
customer_reviews.author: max_smart

customer_reviews.title: Best customer service EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: When I received my pedometer, I had trouble setting it up. (Duh!) I emailed customer service and received a very courteous reply within hours with additional info. My son dropped by and set it up in under 2 minutes so obviously my problem was the nut behind the wheel. This is a great product. The clip hangs on very tightly and the steps are counted accurately. What more could a person ask for? But---the customer service was the thing. If only I could get service like this on all the things I buy. Life would be wonderful! Well, life is pretty wonderful anyway but it would then be AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.author: Allie Otte

customer_reviews.title: Good ol' fashioned pedometer that more that does what it's ...
customer_reviews.text: Good ol' fashioned pedometer that more that does what it's supposed to do. Very easy to set up and easy to use. I love being able to wear it around my neck if I so choose, though I typically just put it on my waist. I don't mind the wrist fancy schmancy pedometers, but since those usually rely on hand-movements to track steps, it's good to fall back on these old fashion style pedometers. I have zero complaints, other than the fact that I totally misplaced it for a few days and was feisty about it. But now I found it and I'm good again lol.
customer_reviews.author: linil

customer_reviews.title: Hate that reset button 😠
customer_reviews.text: I really like the accuracy of this pedometer but it's aggravating because I wear it around my neck and the reset button is easily hit causing me to lose the number of steps I've walked. I think I'm going to have to find an accurate wrist pedometer.
customer_reviews.author: TennesseeGrandma

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My wife has used this unit for several months and is quite pleased. She had used others that did not work as well. The only reason I bought this again was that she thought she had lost her original one and was quite upset. So, I ordered two this time so she would have a back up in case she lost it again. After ordering, she found her original. Guess we have lots of back up now.
customer_reviews.author: artefx

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and easy to wear. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this now for almost a week. I have tested it again and again on my morning walks, and it is about 99% accurate when comparing my manual counting of steps. It is lightweight and easy to read. It is also easy to wear. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Walked over four miles wearing a FitBit and the OneTweak Pedometer to check for accuracy. Step count and mileage were almost identical. The OneTweak EZ-1 Pedometer is easier to read, easier to use, doesn't require frequent charging, doesn't require an app, and costs much less than a FitBit. If you just want a good pedometer for your waIks or jogging I would highly recommend this one. Just remember to set the proper stride length to get an accurate mileage reading.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: too hard to set up!
customer_reviews.text: i cant get it to work. the website is not user-friendly. it is sitting in a drawer waiting for some young relative to happen by and fix it or me.
customer_reviews.author: Paula McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Accurately counts steps
customer_reviews.text: Worn on my hip it's very accurate. I walked 100 steps several times and the count was either 100 or 101. Worn on my pocket the count is about 10% high, but on my hip it's remarkably accurate. It's easy to use and the price is excellent. All I want is a step counter and I've tried several. This is by far the best one I've owned. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Cage

customer_reviews.title: You must buy a strap to keep from losing it
customer_reviews.text: This thing falls of my belt with annoying frequency. Fortunately, I had a strap from another pedometer or I would have lost it early on. Strap for neck that they provide is a bad idea as there is no way that something hanging around you neck will accurately count the steps. Otherwise it doies work well. With a belt strap I'd give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: paulscott

customer_reviews.title: Made the right choice!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this pedometer for price and reputation. I had a wee problem with the set-up (mostly due to my eyesight in poor lighting.) But, as promised, the owner came through with a personal phone call and finished walking me through the completion. The counting seems to be accurate outside my apartment (I must take smaller strides inside.) Btw, if your count is off, you can go back and reset the length of your stride at anytime. Once you're past the set-up, the number display is a comfortable size font. In my opinion, I made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Wesserling

customer_reviews.title: Great pedometer, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This pedometer works very well. I haven't tested it for accuracy but I don't need to know exactly how many steps I did for the day. The instruction sheet tells you all you need to know. It's not rocket science to learn how to set it up. Plus there is an instruction video on YouTube for you. And they even send you an e-mail to make sure you are happy with it which includes a phone number. Then I was sent another e-mail with the instructions included again. So just load your data, height, weight, stride. Set up the time and date and your daily target. I set mine for 10,000 steps. So use it and get your step count.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Extremely inaccurate. I'll be kind and presume i got a bad unit. Sorry if forgot about it so it's beyond the time to request a refund. But doesn't work anywhere close enough to accuracy to be useful.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lund

customer_reviews.title: Great price and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Well I must say I was a little skeptical because the price was so low but it wasn't hard to set up. It's doing what I wanted it to do. I must say I'm very impressed. It's easy for people more seasoned to set up on their own. I have nice watches that I haven't been wearing cause I was wearing a fitbit. This lets me switch up when I want to.
customer_reviews.author: G Mom

customer_reviews.title: allowing me to enjoy the pedometers excellent features
customer_reviews.text: I no doubt contributed to my initial issues with this products setup,but I was ASTOUNDED by the effort expended by customer service (one of the owners) to straighten me out,allowing me to enjoy the pedometers excellent features,but also to experience customer service that went above and beyond, and harkened back to a business - customer relationship too often forgotten. Great pedometer, incredible service should you need it...you will NOT be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: BILLBEN

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not quite what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with it, just a bit too complicated for what I wanted. Perhaps I should have picked a more simple item. I wanted a way to track all my steps during the day, but this seems to be designed to track your exercise periods. Would have to have someone explain how to get the best use out of it. I'll keep it and maybe contact the maker for more instruction at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: Dorrine C

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can wear it around my neck in a pocket, etc. It is pretty accurate and easy to set up. I wanted something that I can just look at during the day to see how much I walked or exercised to help motivate me to move more. It does that because I feel good when I get to 5000 steps or super happy when I am able to get to 8000 plus steps in a day.
customer_reviews.author: meredith

customer_reviews.title: This is a little workhorse
customer_reviews.text: We bought this after we realized the fitbit watches didn't keep an accurate step count. We tried 2 different kinds. So my husband and I are number nerds. This keeps count really well and clips on so it's easy to use and keep on all day. My husband wears is about 80% of the time and loves it. Would absolutely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out how to program this pedometer, it's great! Although it was a little tricky, the sellers provided help by sending emails with set up tips. I just clip it on the top of my pants or in my pocket and it measures steps and distance walked throughout the day. It also counts steps on the elliptical. All I wanted was to count my steps, so this was perfect for my use!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Kaye

customer_reviews.title: a product worth considering!
customer_reviews.text: This product looks wonderful, and the customer care from the company top notch. I unfortunately lack the dexterity for the type of buttons on the pedometer. And although I need to return mine, I encourage you to try it out. It offers a host of functions that I believe you will love!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Blue

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I have a path that I take, a two hour walk. This pedometer has recorded this walk at between 9,000 and 12,000 steps. Yes, I followed instructions regarding placement. I placed it at the same place each time. 33% variability is to me unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: AthroughZ

customer_reviews.title: Accurate step count
customer_reviews.text: After a couple false starts, I was able to setup the pedometer properly. (The setup mistakes were mine, as I did not read the directions carefully.) The step count is spot on and I find myself making sure I walk at least 9 steps so all are recorded. As for the mileage, it is an estimate, for unless all your steps are exactly the entered stride length every time, it will be off somewhat. This is fairly easy on my morning walks but around the house I know the stride varies depending upon my activity. I have had no problems with the counter falling off my waist band, as others have reported. I am quite happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H.

customer_reviews.title: Small and accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I really, really like this little pedometer. It is very accurate (that's why I took my Fitbit back to where I bought it because it wasn't counting the steps I climbed correctly). I actually counted them a couple of times just to check this new one. I have had zero trouble with it coming off my pant waistband. Maybe because I face the screen to my body and not outward, so that the bulk of it is on the inside of my pants, and the clip is facing out. And, since I always wear shirts or sweaters untucked, it isn't even seen. If you just want to count steps, I'd recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: MJB

customer_reviews.title: Nice digital Pedometer.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a digital Pedometer that did not require a smart phone, and minus the weight and expense of a GPS. This fit the bill perfectly. Easy to use. The mode letters are a bit small, but easy to memorize the different settings. Customer service is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: El Cid

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works well and very easy to setup. My husband lost his fitbit because it slipped out of the protective holder very easily and I wanted something that would not get lost so easy. This fits the bill perfectly. He wears it on his waistband and wraps the cord around a belt loop. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bebo39

customer_reviews.title: Friendly service and a great, affordable product!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! I was looking for an accurate but affordable pedometer. Didn't need all the bells and whistles of the Fitbit, and this OneTweak was VERY reasonably priced, plus it had tons of great reviews. I took a chance, and am very happy! I was able to set everything up myself using the included setup brochure. I have found the OneTweak to be very accurate, and it's inspiring me to find creative and fun ways to add more steps to my day. It's definitely helped me become more mindful of my activity levels (especially since I work at a computer for my job), and I would recommend it to anyone. Thanks, OneTweak, for your friendly service and great product!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: 30 days failed after 60 days
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I bought this because it was supposed to keep 30 days in memory. I already had a Yamax pedometer that worked fine. The 30 day function stopped working properly after about 60 days. I emailed the vendor, but no reply. I am giving it a second star because the other functions do seem to work okay.
customer_reviews.author: Jack H

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for myself and one as a gift and neither of us can figure out how to use this thing. Takes too much energy and we don't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Jones

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed in this as he wears it everyday and is ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this pedometer but it only lasts a year. 2 years ago I bought one and after a year the display started disappearing so we changed the battery and the display never came back. So, in August of 2017, I bought another one and last week it did the same thing. I am very disappointed in this as he wears it everyday and is very proud of the miles he walks. I have submitted a picture to show what it looks like after a new batter has been inserted.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Pinard

customer_reviews.title: so accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have had many pedometers over the years, generally losing them because they have fallen off. During this pandemic with my life all changed around, I wondered how many steps I was taking/day. This pedometer is super accurate (I checked multiple times in a variety of distances) and it was amazingly helpful for me to learn how few steps I'm taking now and to make major changes to improve that due to having this feedback. And it attaches very securely to my body and I love the ability to pause it during car trips.
customer_reviews.author: JAMIE E. REDGRAVE

customer_reviews.title: Great pedometer
customer_reviews.text: I like this so much. It is so accurate. Much better than any fit bits. It is more dependable then a fit bit. I love taking my walks daily.
customer_reviews.author: lora

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that was easy to use, provided basic info, and comfortable to wear. Very satisfied with product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Topping

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Product just doesn't work. I took 50 steps and it logged zero steps. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Lani M

customer_reviews.title: Too big for a small framed person to wear
customer_reviews.text: I am 5' tall and small framed. This came and I simply put it back in the box and returned it. It is HUGE and nothing you could wear discreetly with my size body. So not small person friendly
customer_reviews.author: Jonney Miller Snyder

customer_reviews.title: OK product, but some issues
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Quick shipping, quality product, simplicity. Cons: No pause or hold function. A bit too sensitive for me - counts thousands of false "steps" when clipped to my belt or in my pocket while driving. Setup process has maddeningly short timeouts, then you have to start all over again. Stride length can only be set to the nearest inch, so distance accuracy can at best be plus or minus 3.5% for a 30" step, or plus or minus 5% for a 20" step. Display symbol fonts are very small and difficult to read, and top ones get hidden in the shadow of the display edge.
customer_reviews.author: P. A. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my One Tweak for about 3 months now. This is by far the easiest device to set up and use. My One tweak has kept continuous data since I started wearing it. Another feature that I like is that every morning when I put it on it has reset its self to zero for the new day but also keeps the day before and the cumulative data and I don't have to do anything. I put it down when I am done for the day and pick it up the next, it's that easy. Price and performance are top of line with One Tweak. One Tweak measures Steps, Miles, Calories and Minutes.
customer_reviews.author: James Ridenour

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere or “be very careful”!!
customer_reviews.text: You have to be careful with this “touchy pedometer “. If you drop it or bump it in your pocket, the read out increases. Accurate readings are suspect making it “a waste of time and money”.
customer_reviews.author: Rick R

customer_reviews.title: accuracy and clip
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pedometer. I had one earlier and lost it. It is accurate, but I wish the clip was a bit better. It may be that the clip is best since I am not an engineer. I took a small piece of string and tied it on to the clip and a safety pin. I also pin the clip to my pants.
customer_reviews.author: Earla

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This product is up to the exact mile with my treadmill. I tested it to see how it stood up to mileage on treadmill and it was exactly the same. Love the product and very easy to set up compared to others. I also like the one on one set up in e-mail provided by the sellers. It only makes sense that Amazon would hook up with such a worthy seller. The one I had previously was similar, but I choose this one and glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: kindle krazy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted! No Fit Bit for me!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pedometer that did NOT hook up to a computer. Just counting my daily steps. Also didn’t want to wear it on my wrist (had a Fit Bit in the past). I clip it in my shoe and off I go for the day! Also, can wear around the neck, if desired. Does track other things for those interested. Company is very much interested the satisfaction of their customers. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: playwithcolor

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pedometer as a gift for my mother-in-law. The pedometer arrived when expected and was packaged nicely. I was very impressed with the sellers communication with me about the purchase - confirming receipt as well as helps with setup - really exceeded my expectations! I had absolutely no problem with setup, although the setup was difficult for my mother in law as she is not at all "techy." The instructions were clear and easy to follow. Display is easy to read. Step count seems to be accurate. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Pedometer
customer_reviews.text: Service was outstanding and the pedometer is very accurate and does exactly what I was looking for, distance walked, time, number of steps and calories burned. If you looking for something simple and accurate, this is what you need. The price is a lot better than Fitbit. Would recommend it to all who is looking for something simple and very accurate. Service from Amazon and OneTweak was outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: I love it except it tells me I'm not getting enough exercise.
customer_reviews.text: This is a reasonably well-built little instrument. I read a review that said it was poor built quality. I don't know where he/she got that. For the price, it is very well built. Once I got it calibrated, it seems quite accurate. My only complaint is that it's a little complicated to setup but the company included an extra sheet to help with setup. I keep it on me all day, every day - and perhaps a second complain is that I realized that some days I don't enough. This neat little gadget is going to help me get into shape.
customer_reviews.author: dew

customer_reviews.title: What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted. Something simple, this is very easy to set up and very easy to use. I think the step count is very accurate. This is my 2nd pedometer, the first one I bought, just like this one, I accidentally washed in the clothes washer, it didn't work after washing it at first, but as it dried out it seemed fine. Bought another one just to be sure of the accuracy. Highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: MissyCat

customer_reviews.title: Best gadget for motivating me to move!
customer_reviews.text: This is the handiest gadget. I've spent about $200 on different wrist bands that track activity, and none work as well as this. Once you let go of the idea that it has to link up to your Smart Phone, which is a huge waste of time, you'll love this. It's pretty easy to set up, and if you get stuck you just call them and a really nice lady in Texas walks you through the whole process.
customer_reviews.author: Lazell

customer_reviews.title: Good simple pedometer
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying this pedometer. It seems to be more accurate than my Fitbit since it only registers steps and not arm movements. I got this in order to try to avoid the (possibly) harmful emf's of my Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Reader

customer_reviews.title: Nice pedometer and company
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I really like this pedometer. It's compact and accurate. It took me about 20 minutes to set it up. That's how long it took me to figure out the directions. After that, it's been great to use. We had a walking regimen for years and never really knew how far we were walking and our actual pace. Now we know. One Tweak sent us the pedometer promptly and is interested in feedback from buyers/users. Evidently a responsible and customer friendly company. We highly recommend this pedometer for walkers.
customer_reviews.author: Stachu

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I originally bought a fitbit, and found it had just too many extras we didn't need or want--which was frankly annoying. This one is so simple to use, and we are both totally addicted. It's foolproof and we both already lost five pounds!
customer_reviews.author: JT Ultimato

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Thought Out Device
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one that writes product reviews but this product deserves one. I have had pedometers since they were made of stone and this one is the absolute best! The old clock movement ones left a lot to be desired but this one has numerous innovative features and it is very simple to set up, accurately calibrate and easy to use. It appears to be very well made and it is very nicely designed. Thanks for the great product.
customer_reviews.author: Akimbot

customer_reviews.title: This product works great. I like the clip on feature better even ...
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. I like the clip on feature better even than FitBit. I do wish it were smaller. If I click it onto the side of my pants, it often gets knocked off in the course of a day. If I wear it on my bra, in the middle, it does not lay flat enough to not show under clothing. If it came in a smaller size I would order another one. Also, all I want is to know if I got my 10,000 steps per day. I don't need any other info. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Pedometer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little pedometer. I had a Fitbit which I lost and did not want to spend that much money again. This device does pretty much what the Fitbit did except for keeping records online...a function I do not need...and at a much lower cost. It is cool-looking and easy to use. A great idea very well executed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me On Target
customer_reviews.text: My One Tweak has operated flawlessly and accurately for the 5 days I have used it so far ...within 5 steps per hundred three times and exactly on one hundred steps twice. I have not adjusted (tweaked) my measured step since I first set it up upon arrival. I have two dead Fitbits on a shelf which stopped working after about a month each, followed by many attempts at resuscitation. My first ordered One Tweak never showed so I reordered, and Amazon/One Tweak was excellent in getting it to me even a day early.
customer_reviews.author: Duly Makai

customer_reviews.title: ... first pedometer that I have ever bought and I love it. I clip mine on the back of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first pedometer that I have ever bought and I love it. I clip mine on the back of my cap so it is easy to check my progress as I go. The OneTweak pedometer has challenged me to increase the distance of my walks and the owners of the company have been very helpful. I recommend the company and the product to anyone looking for inspiration for their workout.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: I Like It!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this pedometer for a week now & it seems pretty accurate. Set up was easy. Instructions were easy to follow. Step count is good. Not sure about distance because I'm walking indoors. Overall, I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: S. HARTMANN

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I see differences from iPhone health app to this pedometer but sometimes the iPhone gave me different results with the exact walking route from one day to next. This pedometer has been consistent each day. Happy so far
customer_reviews.author: LI country girl

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER ONE WEEK.  NO REPLY FROM SELLER
customer_reviews.text: Was okay while it lasted. Phone number on included Customer Service card was wrong. Was willing to accept a replacement, now I hope for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: SCW

customer_reviews.title: Great no frills pedometer with exceptional customer service
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for setting up the pedometer were very user friendly; very simple, easy to read and to follow. In addition, the CEO provides her personal cell, which I used, should a customer have any questions about how to set the pedometer to use. She is an extraordinary woman! I have found the pedometer very easy to use and to track my steps and mileage...you can't go wrong! This is a great, no frills pedometer, which is exactly what i wanted. I recommend this pedometer over the others for the reasons above.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabet Borregard

customer_reviews.title: set your stride
customer_reviews.text: Follow the directions to measure your stride in inches or your mileage will be inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Basic Pedometer
customer_reviews.text: This pedometer is as basic as advertised to be. Instructions were easy (after I actually followed them), and are printed in the package. The 10 steps appear not to be counted, but they are simply to calculate your gait, and are added back into actual steps taken. I wanted a very basic pedometer, and this one fit the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl D Cardin

customer_reviews.title: Real nice pedometer and unbelievable factory support!
customer_reviews.text: This pedometer was easy to set up and worked lawlessly until I got it wet (my fault) and it stopped working - but the vendor replaced it for free, and already set up for my stride! Never have I had such service. They are working on a water resistant model which I will upgrade to when it becomes available.
customer_reviews.author: trackerman

customer_reviews.title: I chose the OneTweak because the ratings were good. The only concern I had was the set-up ...
customer_reviews.text: Our doctor wanted us to get more steps in. I compared "fitness trackers" and pedometers and settled on the pedometer choice because the research shows that people just quit using the fitness trackers. I chose the OneTweak because the ratings were good. The only concern I had was the set-up but that was fine. The instructions were awesome. Also, OneTweak sent me an e-mail offering assistance with the set up. I would recommend this product to others looking to track their steps.
customer_reviews.author: J. Soito

customer_reviews.title: Accurate tract of steps and miles is motivating.
customer_reviews.text: I love the OneTweak pedometer. It's small and fits snuggly in my pocket. The instructions advise not to place in pocket because of jostling but I wear fitted jeans and haven't had that problem The steps are accurate. I bought it because I'm rehabbing from knee surgery and need to walk a lot. It's motivating, and a little bit addicting, to try to overstep the number from the day before. I also like seeing how may miles I've walked. I did have a little trouble initially setting it up. I think because I held the button down to long. Just click in whichever button you're using (reset and mode for up and down) and it's a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Caplan

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Mom in Oak Lawn, IL for Christmas. She’s loved using it to track her steps! They apparently changed something with that model, and when it had a couple issues after seven months they sent her a new, better one. She loves it and is very glad that they made it easy, so thanks OneTweak!
customer_reviews.author: Mik

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little tracker that can be worn in several ways, depending on where you're comfortable with it. I did end up switching it's position in the case because I kept pushing the reset and mode buttons when I tried to clip it in a pocket. Nice readout so it's easy to see. Seems to be pretty accurate, too.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Reed

customer_reviews.title: OneTweak Pedometer. Great little gadget!
customer_reviews.text: This little pedometer is wonderful. When the fitbit my children gave me for Christmas died, I ordered this pedometer to replace it and believe me it performs better than all the fitbits in the world. The OneTweak gives you all the same info as the more costly alternatives but you don't have to constantly charge it or log in to your computer to find out your stats. It's easy to start up and use. You can't go wrong with this trusty little joy of fitness equipment.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dameron

customer_reviews.title: I love this pedometer!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pedometer! It is as it says: A "Back-to-Basics" unit that counts steps and distance, as well as time. It works perfectly for my needs which is to track how much/how far I am walking. The set-up wasn't difficult and using it is painless. I recommend this to anyone looking for a simple, basic pedometer.
customer_reviews.author: Spud88

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to program and it works. The manual that comes with it is easy to understand. The company seems to offer good service.
customer_reviews.author: ebastro

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied senior citizen
customer_reviews.text: Received my pedometer earlier than expected. I am elderly and am not technology adept. I was unable to set it up. I sent an email to customer support. I was pleasantly surprised to be contacted immediately by the actual CEO of the company! She tried to help me every way possible. She ended up sending me a pre-programmed replacement pedometer! It works GREAT! I REALLY RECOMMEND this pedometer. The product is awesome but the customer service is ABOVE AND BEYOND all expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne M.

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: This is a reliable, handy little step tracker for a very reasonable price. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I only wanted to track steps and it was an easy setup. The company has a video on their website and I just followed it when setting mine up. Liked these so much that I ordered one for every member of family for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Credibility

customer_reviews.title: Works great and now I carry it with me all the ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a simple pedometer to track my steps as I have Parkinson's Disease and need to walk regularly as part of my exercise routine. This little gadget does the trick. Had a little trouble setting it up, but it was our fault, not the instructions. Works great and now I carry it with me all the time.
customer_reviews.author: HERTMAN CASABLANCA

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with the accuracy when the step counting begins
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with the accuracy when the step counting begins, but you must walk about 8 or 9 steps to start the count. There are many times when you do not, but are still walking at a risk pace. As a result instead of 5,000 plus steps a day, you sometimes are credited with only 2,000 or less. This is a disappointment,
customer_reviews.author: Carol D.

product_meta.title: New OneTweak EZ-1 Pedometer for Walking. 3D Tri-Axis Clip-On. Back-to-Basics Step Counter. Simple to Use. Multi-Function. New Pause Function. Perfect Fitness/Exercise Tool.
product_meta.description:
Walk toward fitness, health, and happiness with OneTweak! Our commitment to customer service is unparalleled!

Exceptional complementary setup service and best satisfaction guaranteed program in the business! 

 Just call us for assistance [512 584 9001] 

Our NEW EZ-setup model has a PAUSE function for vehicle travel

 Why Walk with a OneTweak pedometer? 

…OneTweak pedometers are exceptionally accurate and finely crafted; recently rated #1 by Fit&Me. 



…Walking is the BEST health tool available along with healthy eating; it’s free and simple for virtually everyone.

…Walking confers extraordinary benefits for mind, body, AND spirit.

…Pedometers are a great way to keep track of steps AND incentivize more of them.

…Traditional clip-on pedometers are generally more accurate than fancy wrist-band versions due to gesticulation over-counts. 

…Traditional clip-on pedometers give the most value for the money. 

So, take the first step toward a “better” YOU! 

Today! 

With OneTweak!
feature_bullets: Exceptional Guarantee! NEW EZ-Setup Model. Cutting-Edge Accelerometer technology. Simple to Use.
Ranked #1 by Fit&Me & Happier Living today! Best accuracy and craftsmanship.Pause Functin for vehicle travel.Uses the latest 3D Tri Axis technology for superb accuracy.
Counts steps, distance, calories, and time. Tracks 30 individual days in memory. Keeps 7-digits worth of cumulative steps in memory.
Automatically resets daily step count at midnight; hibernates when not in motion and reactivates when in motion. No need to turn on or off. Exceptionally easy to use AFTER setup.
Includes Pedometer, Clip-on Holder, Lanyard, Battery, User Manual. Additional setup tips upon request. Register for Warranty at website.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
